page.title: 13Conservation of Woodlands
page.content: {Hawkbatch Valleys-Forestry Commission} Planted conifers but maintain 1/3 broadleaved trees to conserve variety of wildlife. Amenities provided for public include car parks, picnic tables, and designated walks. {Town Coppice area & North of Seckley {Wood- National Nature Reserve. } Emphasis on conservation of old woods and some meadows.Tradional coppiceing, hay crops taken, no new species intro- duced. Supervised by resident warden. {Wassell Wood}55 acres recently bought by{Woodland Trust,}a charity, after public concern about loss of trees. Oak,Ash and Chestnut have been planted and footpaths are planned.Patrolled by volunteer wardens.{Other woods}are privately owned and small areas are owned by Worcs Nat. Cons. Trust and West Mid. Bird Club;access to members. The woods provide jobs for about 15.
